channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Spectrum Scale
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Spectrum Scale

item.title: CVE-2020-4850|2024-09-16T17:14:03.796Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: IBM Spectrum Scale 1.1.1.0 through 1.1.8.4 Transparent Cloud Tiering could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the leftover files after configuration. IBM X-Force ID: 190298.

item.title: CVE-2020-4926|2024-09-16T16:17:59.228Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: A vulnerability in the Spectrum Scale 5.1 core component and IBM Elastic Storage System 6.1 could allow unauthorized access to user data or injection of arbitrary data in the communication protocol. IBM X-Force ID: 191600.

item.title: CVE-2017-1654|2024-09-16T18:54:11.439Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: IBM Spectrum Scale 4.1.1 and 4.2.0 - 4.2.3 could allow a local unprivileged user access to information located in dump files. User data could be sent to IBM during service engagements. IBM X-Force ID: 133378.

item.title: CVE-2020-4349|2024-09-16T17:18:48.222Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: IBM Spectrum Scale 5.0.0.0 through 5.0.4.4 uses weaker than expected cryptographic algorithms that could allow an attacker to decrypt highly sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 178423.

item.title: CVE-2021-29708|2024-09-16T18:08:42.075Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: IBM Spectrum Scale 5.1.0.1 could allow a local with access to the GUI pod container to obtain sensitive cryptographic keys that could allow them to elevate their privileges. IBM X-Force ID: 200883.

item.title: CVE-2019-4558|2024-09-16T18:18:55.860Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: A security vulnerability has been identified in all levels of IBM Spectrum Scale V5.0.0.0 through V5.0.3.2 and IBM Spectrum Scale V4.2.0.0 through V4.2.3.17 that could allow a local attacker to obtain root privilege by injecting parameters into setuid files.

item.title: CVE-2020-4925|2024-09-16T17:14:46.556Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: A security vulnerability in the Spectrum Scale 5.0 and 5.1 allows a non-root user to overflow the mmfsd daemon with requests and preventing the daemon to service other requests. IBM X-Force ID: 191599.

item.title: CVE-2020-4851|2024-09-16T18:29:04.277Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: IBM Spectrum Scale 5.0.0 through 5.0.5.5 and 5.1.0 through 5.1.0.2 could allow a local user to poison log files which could impact support and development efforts. IBM X-Force ID: 190450.

item.title: CVE-2019-4259|2024-09-16T19:41:57.115Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: A security vulnerability has been identified in IBM Spectrum Scale 4.1.1, 4.2.0, 4.2.1, 4.2.2, 4.2.3, and 5.0.0 with CES stack enabled that could allow sensitive data to be included with service snaps. IBM X-Force ID: 160011.

item.title: CVE-2020-4748|2024-09-16T19:50:55.034Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: IBM Spectrum Scale 5.0.0 through 5.0.5.2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 188517.

item.title: CVE-2018-1993|2024-09-16T16:27:57.707Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: IBM Spectrum Scale (GPFS) 4.1.1, 4.2.0, 4.2.1, 4.2.2, 4.2.3, and 5.0.0 where the use of Local Read Only Cache (LROC) is enabled may caused read operation on a file to return data from a different file. IBM X-Force ID: 154440.

item.title: CVE-2020-4378|2024-09-16T17:28:06.103Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: IBM Spectrum Scale 5.0.0.0 through 5.0.4.4 could allow a privileged authenticated user to perform unauthorized actions using a specially crated HTTP POST command. IBM X-Force ID: 179157.

item.title: CVE-2020-4273|2024-09-16T18:44:16.548Z -- ibm -- spectrum%20scale
item.description: IBM Spectrum Scale 4.2 and 5.0 could allow a local unprivileged attacker with intimate knowledge of the enviornment to execute commands as root using specially crafted input. IBM X-Force ID: 175977.
